comments.body: Don't need this if statement, but I also don't know that this is the correct place for that failure. At this point we know `code` isn't `200` because the if statement to get there is `elif code == 404`

@maxamillion this check has been added to handle the error response scenarios from fn. `create_access_rule` which internally calls checkpoint api `add-access-rule` and only success response of this api will result to `200` rest all will be error response and to handle those error response I have added the respective check. In the case of `success` scenario, the module shall execute without any issue. ref: [add-access-rule](https://sc1.checkpoint.com/documents/latest/APIs/index.html?#web/add-access-rule~v1.4%20)
This will never execute because to get here `if code == 200` has to be `True`
I agree, but this check is added only to be executed when `code != 200` i.e. failure scenarios. If `code == 200` then module shall execute as normal and return the results as expected.
